title: Discovery learning-based digital literacy e-learning program for strengthening scientific inquiry skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills, foundational secondary science curriculum knowledge (experimental design, observation, measurement, data analysis), and understanding of the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: A blended e-learning environment for digital literacy education integrated with science curricula. Learners engage in project-based learning by combining scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis formation, experimental design) with digital tools. Digital devices are institutionally provided, with emphasis on scientific analysis and evidence collection during the learning process.

learning_goals: Learners can critically evaluate science-related online information sources, select experimental data and evidence-based materials, and apply them to digital content creation
Learners can design interactive science education games using web-based tools and implement game mechanics reflecting variable control and hypothesis verification
Learners can operate peer feedback systems using digital collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace) during project execution and share scientific analysis results

resources: Web Game Development Platform (Scratch/Construct) Access Permissions

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
